generic.description: this should validate any element under generic to be valid

specification_level.description: The stack up of this board

file_name.description: The URI of the file that specifies the stackup. Either as a path witin a project compressed file (ZIP) or as a link

specified.description: The container where the elements describing the stackup should be placed. All elements under object must contain the "layer_order" tags to set the order of the layer. They should also contain the "layer_name" tag to set the descriptive name of the layer

items.aliases: Surfacefinish, Surface finish, Coating, finalfinish, Solderable finish, Solderable coating
items.name: Final Finish
items.description: A list of final finishes, can be more than one. E.g. selective finish ENIG and OSP.

items.name: Dielectric
items.description: A list of one of more materials used as dielectric. Every material listed here must have be listed in the materials section with the name of the material as the key. This element is a list and can contain several items

items.aliases: solder mask, sm, solder resist, green mask
items.name: Soldermask
items.description: A list of final soldermasks, can be more than one

legend.name: Legend
legend.description: The legend to be used on the board

stackup.name: Stackup
stackup.description: The stackup of the board: Free stackup (supplier to choose), specified in a separate file or specified in this file. Can also include the stackup itself.

items.aliases: Surfacefinish, Surface finish, Coating, finalfinish, Solderable finish, Solderable coating
items.name: Final Finish
items.description: A list of final finishes, can be more than one. E.g. selective finish ENIG and OSP.

items.name: Dielectric
items.description: A list of one of more materials used as dielectric. Every material listed here must have be listed in the materials section with the name of the material as the key. This element is a list and can contain several items

items.aliases: solder mask, sm, solder resist, green mask
items.name: Soldermask
items.description: A list of final soldermasks, can be more than one

legend.name: Legend
legend.description: The legend to be used on the board

inner_packaging.name: Inner Packaging
inner_packaging.description: This describes how boards are packed together to be shipped. Part of IPC 1601 (4.2.2)

via_protection.name: Via Protection
via_protection.description: The via/hole protection according to IPC 4761

board.name: Board
board.description: The physical description of the board

hard_gold_edge_connectors.name: Hard Gold Edge Connectors
hard_gold_edge_connectors.description: Edge connectors made with hard gold

standards.name: Standards and Requirements
standards.description: If the format is boolean and nothing is stated other than the name of the standard in the Decription column, it should be understood as follows: Are to be met (if Specification), required (in Profile) or possible (in Capability)

country_of_origin.name: Country of Origin
country_of_origin.description: Country of Origin is the country where the Printed Circuit Board is manufactured.

conflict_resolution.name: Conflict resolution
conflict_resolution.description: If several sources of data is present, this hierarchy is to set how to solve conflicts. Please specify a number to indicate priority and avoid setting the same number twice.

items.name: Holes
items.description: One for each holes process, or at least one that sums up the minimum requirements

allowed_modifications.name: Allowed Modifications
allowed_modifications.description: Changes/fabrication decisions that are allowed to make to the files provided.

additional_requirements.name: Additional Requirements
additional_requirements.description: This section is for all requirements that still has not been adapted to the standard or needs to be stated as a comment. It allows you to specify custom elements that should be considered as part of the specification. You specify the value here and then need to create a separate element for it in the custom -> additional section. Multiple elements allowed - to be added as a list.

^(?!generic$).*.description: This part should take care of all the products. Note that products can have any names

additional_requirements.name: Additional Requirements
additional_requirements.description: This section is for all requirements that still has not been adapted to the standard or needs to be stated as a comment. It allows you to specify custom elements that should be considered as part of the specification. You specify the value here and then need to create a separate element for it in the custom -> additional section. Multiple elements allowed - to be added as a list.

capabilities.description: This part should take care of all the products. Note that products can have any names

value.description: If type is hex, the value needs to be a "#" + 6 hexadecimals (e.g. "#FFFFFF"). for "rgb" the format is "rgb(0, 255, 255)", for "cmyk" the format is "cmyk(100%, 0%, 0%, 0%)". The name is just a string.
